info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 3:21PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong cold front will impact portions of North Central Montana through at least 345 PM MDT... At 317 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong cold front along a line extending from 21 miles north of Inverness to 23 miles south of Chester to 14 miles south of The Knees to Choteau to 6 miles south of East Glacier Park Village. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. Scattered thunderstorms have also developed along and behind this front, while gusty northerly winds behind the front have brought wildfire smoke in from Canada. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, brief heavy rainfall, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Smoke behind the cold front may reduce visibility to one mile or less. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Shelby, Conrad, Choteau, Fort Benton, Chester, Fairfield, Valier, Dutton, Lothair, Fort Shaw, Joplin, Brady, The Knees, Highwood, Heart Butte, East Glacier Park Village, Inverness, Black Eagle and Gildford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
